metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39417 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
IN THE EXTENSION SCRIPT, a SQL Injection vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL if it uses @extowner@, @extschema@, or @extschema:...@ inside a quoting construct (dollar quoting, '', or ""). If an administrator has installed files of a vulnerable, trusted, non-bundled extension, an attacker with database-level CREATE privilege can execute arbitrary code as the bootstrap superuser.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39417` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
libecpg6 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
libpq5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.25-0ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm5').
